Strings.The on-disk location where instances wil: The on-disk location where instances will be stored. Changing this will not affect existing instances, only newly created ones.
Strings.The maximum number of instances that can: The maximum number of instances that can be provisioned on this datastore. 0 for unlimited.
Strings.Datastores that reach or exceed this lim: Datastores that reach or exceed this limit in total size will not be considered as deployment targets. This is only a soft limit and does not prevent instances on this datastore from using more space.
Strings.Instances with a lower priority number a: Instances with a lower priority number are preferred over those with a higher number, all other factors being equal.
Strings.Deactivating a datastore prevents new in: Deactivating a datastore prevents new instances from being provisioned to it.

Strings.Otherwise, you can connect using your ch: Otherwise, you can connect using your chosen SFTP client using the following details:
Strings.Your username and password are the same: Your username and password are the same as those used to log into the panel.

Strings.Are you sure you wish to delete this use: Are you sure you wish to delete this user? This operation cannot be undone.
Strings.Are you sure you wish to delete this rol: Are you sure you wish to delete this role? This operation cannot be undone.

Strings.Instances in Docker containers are isola: Instances in Docker containers are isolated from other instances and the rest of the system, at the expense of a minor performance impact.
Strings.If the memory policy is 'reserve', how m: If the memory policy is 'reserve', how much memory should be set aside for this container as a minimum. If the memory policy is 'restrict', how much memory this container may use maximum. Setting to 0 results in no limit.
Strings.The maximum number of CPU shares that th: The maximum number of CPU shares that this container may use. Roughly matches up with the number of CPU cores/threads the container can use but non-multithreaded applications may not see performance increases from higher values. Setting to 0 results in no limit.

Strings.If enabled, AMP will be able to upload b: If enabled, AMP will be able to upload backups to any S3 compatible storage service.
Endpoint for your S3 compatible service.
Strings.The name of the bucket to be used for th: The name of the bucket to be used for this instances backups. Use different buckets for different instances.
Strings.Your access key for your chosen S3 servi: Your access key for your chosen S3 service
Strings.Your secret key for your chosen S3 servi: Your secret key for your chosen S3 service
Strings.Whether all backups should be uploaded,: Whether all backups should be uploaded, or just those for which there is insufficient space to store locally.
Strings.If you're using GMail - you will need to: If you're using GMail - you will need to request an
Strings.Additional directories to show up as sho: Additional directories to show up as shortcuts inside the file manager
Strings.Bypasses the API for file transfers. A r: Bypasses the API for file transfers. A restart of AMP is required for this setting change to take effect.
Strings.If an instance fails to start due to a l: If an instance fails to start due to a licence failure, ADS will attempt to automatically reactivate it.
Strings.When ADS starts, automatically start any: When ADS starts, automatically start any instances that should be run on-boot if they're not already running.
Strings.When bulk starting instances, how many m: When bulk starting instances, how many milliseconds delay should be inserted between each instance start?
Strings.Sources of git repositories to fetch dep: Sources of git repositories to fetch deployment templates from. Use of third party sources is unregulated and entirely at your own risk.
Strings.If enabled, AMP takes into account the n: If enabled, AMP takes into account the number of CPU cores when calculating total CPU usage, otherwise it calculates assuming one core. A restart is required after changing this setting for it to take effect.
Strings.If enabled, SMT cores (Hyperthreading, e: If enabled, SMT cores (Hyperthreading, etc) are ignored when calculating CPU usage of processes. E.g. when disabled a quad core with hyperthreading is treated like an 8 core system, when enabled it's treated like a 4 core system. A restart is required after changing this setting for it to take effect.
Strings.How many minutes into the past should th: How many minutes into the past should the console show when a user logs in. (Affects all users)
Strings.Gathers extended information for running: Gathers extended information for running AMP processes
Strings.Reports memory usage only as physical RA: Reports memory usage only as physical RAM usage, ignoring swap usage. Doesn't apply when full process metrics is enabled.
Strings.How frequently AMP should push metrics d: How frequently AMP should push metrics data to connected sessions
Strings.Which IP address new AMP instances shoul: Which IP address new AMP instances should use by default.
Strings.Which IP address applications deployed b: Which IP address applications deployed by AMP should use by default.
Strings.Which IP AMP should report for instances: Which IP AMP should report for instances created within Docker when no specific IP is specified
Strings.Lists of ports that can be used by AMP t: Lists of ports that can be used by AMP to create AMP instances. Specify port ranges by separating the upper and lower bounds by a colon (e.g. 8080:8180). These ports must not be used by other services.
Strings.Whether AMP should only use those ports: Whether AMP should only use those ports explicitly assigned to it, or if it can use all ports except those explicitly excluded.
Strings.Allow all except excluded: ì œì™¸ëœ í¬íŠ¸ë¥¼ ì œì™¸í•˜ê³  ëª¨ë‘ í—ˆìš©
Strings.Lists of ports that can be used by appli: Lists of ports that can be used by application servers created by AMP. Specify port ranges by separating the upper and lower bounds by a colon (e.g. 25565:25665). These ports must not be used by other services.
Strings.Lists of ports that AMP will not assign: Lists of ports that AMP will not assign to applications or to itself. Ports 0 through 1024 or those allocated to the AMP instance port ranges will never be used regardless.
Strings.Binds docker containers directly to the: Binds docker containers directly to the host network adapter by default.
Strings.Apply Traefik labels to docker instances: Apply Traefik labels to docker instances. (Experimental!)
Strings.The docker network to be used for Traefi: The docker network to be used for Traefik managed instances.
Strings.The wildcard domain to be used to access: The wildcard domain to be used to access Traefik managed instances. Must take the format of *.domain.tld
Strings.When running as a controller, how instan: When running as a controller, how instances on remote targets should be accessed. In 'Direct' mode it will connect directly to that instance, bypassing the target - which requires extra security and firewall rules.
Strings.The licence key to use for newly created: The licence key to use for newly created instances
Strings.Default settings to be applied to all ne: Default settings to be applied to all new instances
Strings.Which release stream to use by default w: Which release stream to use by default when creating or updating instances
Strings.Creates all new instances inside Docker: Creates all new instances inside Docker containers transparently.
Strings.The URL of the authentication server to: The URL of the authentication server to be used by new instances
Strings.If enabled, the Default Auth Server URL: If enabled, the Default Auth Server URL will be copied to all targets when they are added to ADS
Strings.What should happen by default to newly c: What should happen by default to newly created instances.
Strings.If enabled, new instances will not have: í™œì„±í™”ëœ ê²½ìš° ìƒˆ ì¸ìŠ¤í„´ìŠ¤ì—ëŠ” ê¸°ë³¸ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ì‹œìŠ¤í…œ ë°©í™”ë²½ì— í•„ìš”í•œ í¬íŠ¸ê°€ ì¶”ê°€ë˜ì§€ ì•ŠìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.
Strings.The maximum number of instances that may: The maximum number of instances that may exist within this ADS target
Strings.If disabled, this ADS instance will only: If disabled, this ADS instance will only pass provision requests to other ADS instances and never create instances locally.
Strings.The maximum amount of disk space to allo: The maximum amount of disk space to allow for all stored backups
Strings.The maximum amount of disk space (uncomp: The maximum amount of disk space (uncompressed) to allow for a single backup
Strings.The maximum number of backups to store i: The maximum number of backups to store irrespective of size
Strings.What action should be taken if the backu: What action should be taken if the backup limit is reached and a new backup is started
Strings.What level of compression to apply to ne: What level of compression to apply to newly created backups. Lower levels of compressison require less CPU time to create and extract, but result in larger files.
Strings.How many minutes the sliding window shou: ìŠ¬ë¼ì´ë”© ì°½ì´ ì¸ì¦ ì‹¤íŒ¨ë¥¼ í™•ì¸í•˜ëŠ” ë° í•„ìš”í•œ ì‹œê°„(ë¶„)ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤.
Strings.If more than this number attempts occurs: ë¹„ìœ¨ ì œí•œ ì‹œê°„ ë‚´ì— ì„¤ì •ëœ íšŸìˆ˜ë³´ë‹¤ ë§ì€ ì‹œë„ê°€ ë°œìƒí•˜ë©´ í•´ë‹¹ IP ì£¼ì†ŒëŠ” ë” ì´ìƒ ë¡œê·¸ì¸ ìš”ì²­ì„ í•  ìˆ˜ ì—†ê²Œ ë©ë‹ˆë‹¤
Strings.When enabled, web sessions are tied to t: When enabled, web sessions are tied to the IP address that initiated them. This improves security, but can cause problems with fast changing/dynamic routing IPs (often found on cheaper ISPs or Campuses)
Strings.Automatically sends anonymous error repo: Automatically sends anonymous error report to CubeCoders if AMP encounters an error from which it can't recover.
Strings.Whether or not the types of files that c: Whether or not the types of files that can be uploaded should be restricted
Whether or not the types of files that can be downloaded should be restricted
Strings.Which file extensions can be downloaded: Which file extensions can be downloaded via the file manager or via SFTP
Strings.Which file extensions can be Uploaded vi: Which file extensions can be Uploaded via the file manager or via SFTP
Strings.Allowing extension changes could let a u: Allowing extension changes could let a user upload a file as one type, and change it later
Strings.Allow folders to be archived, and archiv: Allow folders to be archived, and archives to be extracted
Strings.Only allow extensions in the approved 'u: Only allow extensions in the approved 'upload' list to be extracted from archives
Strings.Automatically bans IP addresses from SFT: Automatically bans IP addresses from SFTP logins if they try to login as
Strings.Item IDs for steam workshop items that s: ë©”ì¸ ì• í”Œë¦¬ì¼€ì´ì…˜ì´ ì—…ë°ì´íŠ¸ë  ë•Œ ë‹¤ìš´ë¡œë“œ/ì—…ë°ì´íŠ¸í•´ì•¼ í•˜ëŠ” Steam ì°½ì‘ë§ˆë‹¹ ì•„ì´í…œì˜ ì•„ì´í…œ IDì…ë‹ˆë‹¤
Strings.Some applications require multiple attem: Some applications require multiple attempts at an update to actually update correctly (notably those that use App ID 90). If enabled AMP will retry updates on certain error conditions that would normally indicate failure.
Strings.How many times AMP should attempt to aut: How many times AMP should attempt to automatically retry failed updates if 'Automatically retry on failure' is enabled.
Strings.Which method AMP should use to check for: Which method AMP should use to check for application updates, by either comparing the build timestamps, or by comparing the build ID from the application manifest.
Strings.The password to be used for participatin: The password to be used for participating in betas via SteamCMD if required.
Strings.Limits downloads to a given speed (In me: Limits downloads to a given speed (In megabits/sec) to avoid disrupting other applications. 0 for unlimited.
Make a GET request to a URI.
Make a POST request to a URI.
Strings.Push a message via PushBullet to a speci: PushBulletì„ í†µí•´ íŠ¹ì • ì±„ë„ì— ë©”ì‹œì§€ í‘¸ì‹œ
Strings.Restart the application server, but only: ì• í”Œë¦¬ì¼€ì´ì…˜ ì„œë²„ ë‹¤ì‹œ ì‹œì‘(ë¹„ì–´ ìˆëŠ” ê²½ìš°ì— í•œí•˜ì—¬)
Strings.Run a command in one hour, with warnings: Run a command in one hour, with warnings (non-blocking)
Strings.Schedule an update and restart once the: Schedule an update and restart once the last user leaves, or immediately if empty.
Strings.Update the application and restart it if: ì´ì „ë¶€í„° ì‹¤í–‰ ì¤‘ì¼ ê²½ìš°, ì• í”Œë¦¬ì¼€ì´ì…˜ ì—…ë°ì´íŠ¸ í›„ ë‹¤ì‹œ ì‹œì‘
Strings.Restarting this instance may take up to: Restarting this instance may take up to a minute. You will not be able to log into any instances that depend on this ADS instance.
Strings.The standard location for AMP instances,: The standard location for AMP instances, and where the ADS instance will be stored. This datastore cannot be deleted.
Strings.This application may have extra requirem: This application may have extra requirements or dependencies that are not satisfied by the host system.
